questions.question: In what year did Timișoara become the **first city in Eastern Europe** to have its streets illuminated with electric public lighting?
Timișoara is often referred to by a nickname due to its similar architectural style, reflecting its history within the Austrian Empire. What is this nickname?
Which major historical event in Romania began in Timișoara in December 1989?
Which river flows through the city of Timișoara?
What is the name of the most prominent Baroque-style square in Timișoara's historic center, home to the Roman Catholic Cathedral?
Timișoara was the European Capital of Culture in which year?
The city is located in the historical region of Romania known as:
What is the name of the large Orthodox cathedral, a symbol of the city, located in Piața Victoriei (Victory Square)?
The **Huniade Castle** (Castelul Huniade), the oldest building in Timișoara, now houses which institution?
What mode of public transport, besides buses, operates in Timișoara and is a key part of its public transit system?
